Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw two students using a string telephone to show communication over a distance, clearly illustrating both the students and the string.
The student can effectively illustrate the use of sound to send messages through the string telephone by including arrows or symbols that demonstrate the flow of sound or information.
The student can depict how the design, such as cups attached to the string, helps solve the problem of communicating over a distance.
The student can represent the string being stretched tight, indicating its importance for effective communication.
The student can use labels or brief explanations to describe how the string telephone works, such as notes indicating sound travels through the string.
The student can show how using the string telephone is similar to other technologies used for communication, like drawings or notes comparing it to modern phones.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally leave out minor details, such as forgetting to label one component of the telephone system but generally understands its significance.

The student might not distinguish clearly between different types of communication technologies (e.g., shows all as identical without indicating differences) but captures the basic idea of communication over distance.
